text: How do you setup a unsubscribe pages for different sub domains?

Anyone with a example for how to setup advanced filters on a blog overview, with realtime updating (so without page reload)? I have articles where I set some data inside the blog itself which I want to use as filter options. I can export this to the overview template, but after that I am pretty stuck on how to move forward.

So on the left are the filters, and the listdata you see inside the cards, is the data I did get from the article itself, and which will be used as filter option as well.

I don’t know if this is possible. They were working on adding it to Ent level, but I think that’s for multiple domains, not subdomains.

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Unsubscribe-pages-for-different-brands/idi-p/22062>
Even if you pay for business units, it’s a feature they’re working on to have multiple unsub pages

With stuff like this you're either looking at loading all the posts via hubl and then using js to show and hide them dynamically - or you're looking at making Ajax calls when filters are applied. 

The choice is more or less up to you. And the amount of total blogs there are. Or whether or not it makes much sense to load all of the posts right away.
Has anyone tried integrating / established a good system for using Sentry with HubSpot for tracking errors?
